After ongoing discussions and planning with area districts, all CCSD59 schools will be closed next week starting Monday, March 16, through Friday, March 20. Spring break will continue as scheduled from March 23 through March 27. All CCSD59 schools are currently scheduled to resume classes on Monday, March 30.

The decision to close schools is being made as a preventative measure to help contain the spread of the COVID-19 coronavirus. The safety and health of our students, staff, families, and community is our top priority. While we know this closure will present difficulties for families, we believe it is a necessary step to help minimize the potential for community spread of the COVID-19 coronavirus.

For information on how eLearning days will be utilized during this time, click here: ccsd59.org/news/ccsd59-schools-closed-march-16-20

We are continuing to closely monitor the ongoing developments regarding the COVID-19 coronavirus.

At the current recommendation of IDPH, all CCSD59 schools will continue to remain open during the school day. However, starting today, Thursday, March 12, 2020, we will be canceling all before and after school clubs, sporting events, evening activities, assemblies that bring in outside guests, and other activities with outside visitors until further notice. This includes the use of our buildings by outside organizations who rent our facilities.

If your child is in the before and after school child care programs, those programs are not canceled and will continue to be offered unless you are otherwise notified by the program.

We will send out an additional email communication this afternoon with further details and recommendations regarding the district’s planning for COVID-19. The safety of our students, staff, families, and community is our top priority.
